timeline.message: Upgrade to Gradle 6.4 to make use of modules

timeline.bodyText: According to https://gradle.org/install/ the "current Gradle release is 6.6.1" -- why 6.4?
timeline.author: sormuras

replies.bodyText:
According to https://gradle.org/install/ the "current Gradle release is 6.6.1" -- why 6.4?

I only updated to the least needed version according to your other link to support modules. Didn't thought about going to a higher version  in hope to get less problems through the Gradle update in combination with trying to introduce the module file.
replies.author: Bukama

replies.bodyText: Also it seems that upgrading to 6.6.1 needs further investigation, see #328 . So I'll stick to 6.4 for this PR.
replies.author: Bukama

replies.bodyText: #328 was merged, so this has been resolved.
replies.author: Bukama

timeline.bodyText: Does the resulting JAR file still run on Java 8?
timeline.author: sormuras

replies.bodyText: Hmm. I have to reed up if Java 8 can handle the module-info. look at Nicolais book in my shelf
replies.author: Bukama

replies.bodyText: JPMS came with Java 9. Java 8 works with module-info.java by basically ignoring it, afaik.
replies.author: Michael1993

replies.bodyText:
JPMS came with Java 9. Java 8 works with module-info.java by basically ignoring it, afaik.

Not when the module-file is in src/main :D But I got it.
replies.author: Bukama

timeline.author: nipafx

timeline.bodyText: Can't look at the code right now, but can you check whether you can replace this call with our internal annotation utils? (Same for TimeoutExtension.)
timeline.author: nipafx

replies.bodyText: No it's not possible at the moment, because the PioneerAnnotationUtils are package private and both extensions are in the vintage package. If they weren't I guess we would have already changed them, when we introduced our helper class.
replies.author: Bukama

timeline.message: Update main-build to copy module file

timeline.bodyText: Hmmm Looks more like not 8 instead of 11 - and it is the module info so I would go with "copy module info" - I think the rest is implicit knowledge by java, and is easy readable via the action
timeline.author: aepfli
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -40,6 +40,9 @@ jobs:
         with:
           path: ~/.sonar/cache/
           key: ${{ runner.os }}-sonar
+      - name: Copy module on Java 11

timeline.author: sormuras
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -40,6 +40,9 @@ jobs:
         with:
           path: ~/.sonar/cache/
           key: ${{ runner.os }}-sonar
+      - name: Copy module on Java 11
+        if: matrix.java != '8'
+        run: cp src/main/module/module-info-java src/main/java

timeline.message:
Rename step to copy
fix filename

Pass if building with modules to change source compatibility.

But Junit is not found

Exclude module-info from checkstyle checks

The module info can't be parsed by checkstyle.xml
see: https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_filefilters.html#BeforeExecutionExclusionFileFilter
Move 'copy module-info.java' from GH Action to Gradle
Rename Gradle property `withModules` to `modularBuild` and make it Boolean
